task_summary: Pick up the die from the shelf using the robotic arm, confirming detection, approach, grasp, and successful lift.

task_long_description.overview: This episode involves a robotic arm tasked to pick a white die positioned on the shelf. The robot first detects the die, then approaches by opening the gripper and positioning itself above. Next, it computes a top grasp pose, aligns precisely, executes the grasp, and verifies the die is held. The environment includes furniture and non-task objects, but the focus remains on manipulating the die. Accuracy in perception and alignment are essential.
preconditions: Die is present and accessible on the shelf
Robot arm is powered and initialized
Gripper is unoccupied and capable of opening
stepwise_plan: Verify die is visible or scan for it
Move above the die with proper offset
Compute a top grasp pose for the die
Approach and align gripper to pose with tight tolerance
Perform grasp at computed pose with 'top' strategy
success_criteria: Die is securely grasped and lifted by the arm
No drop or collision occurs during the pick process
Sensors confirm die is held in gripper
failure_and_recovery: Die not detected—trigger ScanForTarget up to 3 times
task_long_description.termination: Task terminates once die is confirmed to be grasped by the gripper.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the die is visible to sensors.
Scans for the die using grid pattern, up to 3 attempts.
Detects the location of the die.
Opens the gripper to a suitable width for die grasping.
Moves the gripper above the die at 5cm offset.
Computes a suitable top grasp pose for the die.
Approaches and aligns to the die with tight tolerance.
Executes grasp at computed pose using top strategy.
Verifies the die is now held by the gripper.

failure_modes: Die not visible due to occlusion
recovery_strategy: Scan for die up to 3 times
Retry approach and align if misaligned
Retry grasp if die not in gripper
assumptions: Instruction matches visual evidence: white die present and clear grasp scene
No placement or transfer required; place phase omitted
Grasp pose determined from scene (top-down possible)
If die unreachable, task cannot complete; no evidence for failure recovery beyond retry

expected_success_criteria: Die detected, approached, grasped, and held by gripper
